>Ape's Library
mega.nz/folder/jlEwhYyJ#iK4mVC4y5iwk_cr3eIpX4g

>Mysticism
Jewish — Jewish Meditation
Hindu — Raja Yoga
Taoist — Foundations of Internal Alchemy
Theravada — Knowing and Seeing
Zen — Zen Mind Beginner's Mind
Sufi — Sufism for Non-Sufis
Christian — Cloud of Unknowing

>Grimoires
Agrippa's Three Books are a must
Arbatel should be the first grimoire to work with; later on you can work with Heptameron, Goetia, Book of Abramelin, Picatrix, etc.
The PGM tend to be pretty modular

>Vajrayana
Intro to Tantra, Refining Gold. Garchen Rinpoche and HHDL's entire YouTube catalogs; you can even take empowerment and transmission from their recordings, if vows are understood. Look into centers in your area & others that offer empowerment online. Avoid NKT, Rigpa, and Shambhala. You can also self-initiate with the Samadhi Empowerment
studybuddhism.com

>Golden Dawn
In order: Tree of Life, Mystical Qaballah, Middle Pillar, Golden Dawn

>Aurum Solis
Magical Philosophy (70s editions go from I-V, modern ones from I-III), then Planetary Magick
Their Practical Guide series for whatever

>Martinism
In the Freemason folder there is Martinism folder — read everything
Then try to find Treatise on the Reintegration of Beings, as well as the works of Saint-Martin and Papus, in French
youtube.com/c/OrdreMartinistesSouverains

>Aspire to A∴A∴
Have a basic understanding of the Golden Dawn system. Read Liber ABA, then go through this reading list:
ordoaa.org/studlist.htm
Focus on Liber Resh, E , RV, O, Astarte, and HHH
For a full curriculum, Mystical and Magical System of the A∴A∴

>Chaos Magic
Liber Null and Psychonaut, Condensed Chaos, Liber Kaos, Hands-On Chaos Magic, Six Ways

>Theosophy/Sophiology
Pseudo-Dionysius: The Complete Works
Angelic Spirituality
Theologia Mystica (janelead.org/resources.html)
Way to Christ first, then the rest of Jakob Böhme
jacobboehmeonline.com
Initiation into Three Worlds
An Outline of Sophiology

Quick reminders for beginners:
-don't forget to write your dreams down after waking up. no matter how little detail, just do it
-reality checks aren't likely to give you a LD by themselves, think of them as a stepping stool, they are not a replacement for techniques
-WBTB is mostly mandatory for most people, if you struggle with your sleep schedule then ADA is your best option
-if you're just starting out you should be doing WBTB in addition to either SSILD or MILD as those two are the easiest techniques

I'm new to western esotericism, but the Nag Hammadi scriptures have peaked my interest.

My impression is that Gnostics and Hermeticists share the same basic world view, but whereas the Gnostics seek only to extricate themselves from the material world and abhor the demiurge, the Hermeticists respect or even serve the demiurge and try to use their understanding of how the world works to gain power within the material world, including through magic rituals etc. as seen in the Golden Dawn.
Am I getting this right?

last_replies.name: Anonymous
last_replies.com:
>>33470280
Somewhat yes and no. The problem is that "gnosticism" is a reallh broad category with a lot of differing and even competing schools of thought. It's a bit like the term "Christianity:" do "Christians" believe in Free Will or not? A Catholic would say yes, a Calvinist would say no. Likewise, as to whether the Demiurge is evil, a Sethian would say yes, while a Valentinian would say no.

Likewise, outside the NHL itself, there are many gnostic flavored magic rituals etc. for practical use in the material world. We know of this through things like Abraxas stones and amulets. And even within the NHL, there's ambiguity about the material world: in the Gospel of Thomas Jesus says that the Kingdom of Heaven is already both within humanity and spread out across the world, with the only problem being that people don't see it (because the world distracts them).
>His disciples said to him, "When will the kingdom come?"
>"It won't come by looking for it. They won't say, 'Look over here!' or 'Look over there!' Rather, the Father's kingdom is already spread out over the earth, and people don't see it."
Thomas 113

There's even a sort of pseudo-pantheism, where Jesus identifies himself as the Light of the All that is within the All, including the material world.
>Jesus said, "I'm the light that's over all. I am the All. The All has come from me and unfolds toward me.
>"Split a log; I'm there. Lift the stone, and you'll find me there."
Thomas 77
(This of course comes with the bonus of you personally also being the light elsewhere in Thomas, but that's not super relevant for this discussion.) The same pantheism/panentheism thing occurs in Thunder: Perfect Mind and the Trimorphic Protennoia, just with Sophia (who is also Jesus, it's complicated.)

A nice middle ground is something like The Gospel of Philip
>Don't fear the flesh, nor love it. If you fear it, it'll master you; if you love it, it'll swallow and choke you.

last_replies.name: Anonymous
last_replies.com:
>>33470280
A pretty well preserved copy of Hermetic scriptures was found at Nag Hammadi along with the Gnostic gospels, so people back then likely shared that opinion. All of these things, and I would include proto-orthodox Christianity as well, likely share a lot of common origins. All of these ideas were floating around simultaneously and people were all grappling with them, adding their own ideas, and allowing it to evolve organically. It's just how mythology and spiritual thought works. It's never just perfectly ascended from the Heavens in some kind of complete form and preserved perfectly and handed from generation to generation.

This is true even of modern spirituality in the major traditions. It's often been pointed out that the common American folk version of Christianity has a distinctly Gnostic flare to it which would have been massively alien to most early "orthodox" Christians. If you were to ask the average elementary school student from a quasi-religious household (someone whose family identifies as Christian and maybe goes to church on special occasions or whatever) what happens when you die, they will likely tell you that if you're good you go to Heaven for eternity, and if you're bad you go to hell. Nothing about a regenerated Earth or resurrection into a physical body or great day of judgement for all human beings at the end of the age or any number of other ideas present in the canon Gospels. You just die and spend eternity in a purely spiritual dimension and live with God and are happy forever. That's a pretty Gnostic take, to be honest.

There was Eru, the One, who in Arda is called Iluvatar; and he made first the Ainur, the Holy Ones, that were the offspring of his thought, and they were with him before aught else was made. And he spoke to them, propounding to them themes of music; and they sang before him, and he was glad. But for a long while they sang only each alone, or but few together, while the rest hearkened; for each comprehended only that part of the mind of Iluvatar from which he came, and in the understanding of their brethren they grew but slowly. Yet ever as they listened they came to deeper understanding, and increased in unison and harmony.

And it came to pass that Iluvatar called together all the Ainur and declared to them a mighty theme, unfolding to them things greater and more wonderful than he had yet revealed; and the glory of its beginning and the splendour of its end amazed the Ainur, so that they bowed before Iluvatar and were silent.

Then Iluvatar arose, and the Ainur perceived that he smiled; and he lifted up his left hand, and a new theme began amid the storm, like and yet unlike to the former theme, and it gathered power and had new beauty. But the discord of Melkor rose in uproar and contended with it, and again there was a war of sound more violent than before, until many of the Ainur were dismayed and sang no longer, and Melkor had the mastery. Then again Iluvatar arose, and the Ainur perceived that his countenance was stern; and he lifted up his right hand, and behold! a third theme grew amid the confusion, and it was unlike the others. For it seemed at first soft and sweet, a mere rippling of gentle sounds in delicate melodies; but it could not be quenched, and it took to itself power and profundity. And it seemed at last that there were two musics progressing at one time before the seat of Iluvatar, and they were utterly at variance. The one was deep and wide and beautiful, but slow and blended with an immeasurable sorrow, from which its beauty chiefly came. The other had now achieved a unity of its own; but it was loud, and vain, and endlessly repeated; and it had little harmony, but rather a clamorous unison as of many trumpets braying upon a few notes. And it essayed to drown the other music by the violence of its voice, but it seemed that its most triumphant notes were taken by the other and woven into its own solemn pattern.

Recent science has given us some reliable predictors of longevity, grip strength, upper body strength, and how easily we can get up from being on the floor. threads.com:
One of the worst nightmares you ever had, one that was so traumatic and hasn't left your mind in years.

I'll start,
>around 13-15 years old
>nightmare starts by me falling through a red lit tube at a speedy fall
>everything feels hot and sticky, blood is allover the walls
>make it to the end of the tube and I get launched into a pile of red flesh and guts
>i have to swim out of it and it took a while for me to get out, the smell was metallic and rotten
>make it out and fall on the floor, I get a good look of where I am
>it's a large labyrinth, the walls are covered in red flesh and organs, the room breathes and constanly moves around. I hear nothing but breathing and a disturbed deep moaning throughout the room
>I get up and realise that I'm naked, covered in blood and cuts
>there's a row of wooden pikes right in front of me, I start walking up to them
>as I walk, my legs get sunk into the fleshy, meaty floor
>takes heaps of effort and strength just to get to the pikes
>I get a good look at the pikes, there's dozens of heads of children on them, some are more decomposed and some are skeletons
> I go up to the left side of the row and there's a fresh head of a young girl with flies and maggots pouring out of her mouth
>the room starts to scream and I hear what sounds like a incoming wave of something behind me, I can't turn around and look
>the girls head opens her eyes and looks at me, she opens her mouth
>"help me" she says in a distorted and echoed voice
>I wake up instantly, covered in sweat and my body temperature is red hot
>I check the time on my phone and it's 3:33am
I pretty much got sent to hell for a good 5 minutes and had a good look, I wonder if everyone gets these dreams just to show you what it's like.

I don't think it's real in the way most of us think it is, at least not materially. It's called the SUPERnatural right? It's not the opposite of natural, it's something that is so natural that it is perceived as being unnatural. Thinking about how I've changed during my life there has never been any force to compel me to do anything except my thoughts and the words of others, and our thoughts and the words of others are things we have become so accustomed to we don't filter them. We have free will and can make our own decisions, but how much of ourselves is just the recycled jargon of others? Magic is purely memetic, you have the ability to influence the collective in ways you never thought imaginable. We are tribal by nature, we look to others for answers, left alone with no one to speak to we would go insane, and without even our own thoughts we would cease to exist, but our thoughts are a just a product of our environment. So we don't really exist. The soul is purely immaterial, and so is thought, our souls and our words are made of the same substance. Therefore, with practice, we can alter the very souls of anyone we chose, including ourselves. If we form our thoughts to be strong, and easily digestible we can sway the masses to do anything, but people have already known this. They've already been doing this, but we can fight back. Those in power constantly use this ability of memetic manipulation I've spoken of, yet they convince us it isn't real and that we do not have the ability to do the same things they do, but we do. You have the ability to change the world. We all do.
